statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Portland 74, Lewis & Clark 64
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Jamie Jones came off the bench to score 14 points and grab 12 rebounds as Portland beat Lewis & Clark 74-64 on Sunday. Kevin Field added 12 points and 13 rebounds for Portland (4-12), which struggled for much of the afternoon against the Division III Pioneers. Jeff Christensen's 3-pointer with a minute left in the first half gave Lewis & Clark a 36-35 lead. The Pilots scored the last basket before the break and pulled away in the second half. Mark Robinowitz hit 5 3-pointers for Lewis & Clark (6-4) and led all scorers with 21 points. David Berggren added 17 points for the Pioneers, who made only 34 percent of their shots in the second half. The Pilots had an advantage inside throughout the game, outrebounding the Pioneers 53-26. In an effort to limit Portland's strength, Lewis & Clark started leaving the perimeter open in the second half and the Pilots seized the opportunity. Parker Emerson's 3-pointer four minutes into the second half gave Portland the lead for good at 45-42. The basket started a 17-5 run that pushed the Pilot lead to 59-47 with nine minutes left. Robinowitz hit a fade-away jumper and a 3-pointer to whittle the deficit to seven, but the Pioneers would get no closer.
